data.title: John Gage - Men's Basketball 2013-14
data.meta_description: Men's Basketball 2013-14 - John Gage: The Official Athletic Site of Stanford University, partner of WMT Digital. The most comprehensive coverage of Stanford Athletics with rosters, schedules, scores, highlights, game recaps, and more!
data.text:
FEATURES: San Francisco Chronicle (2/12/14) | Seattle Times (2/9/13) | San Francisco Chronicle (1/24/13) | www.gostanford.com (1/26/12) | www.gostanford.com (2/20/11)

2013-14: Game-by-Game Stats ... Pac-12 All-Academic First Team honoree â€¦ played in 34 games, making only start on Senior Day ... averaged 3.3 points and 1.6 rebounds ... shot 35-99 (35.7 percent) from the field and 26-77 (33.8 percent) from three-point territory ... chipped in with 12 points (4-5 3FG) against BYU off the bench (Nov. 11) ... added seven points and four rebounds in 15 minutes off bench against UC Davis (Dec. 14) ... tallied six points in 16 minutes as a reserve against Michigan (Dec. 21) ... finished with eight points (3-3 FG) in 10 minutes against Cal Poly (Dec. 29) ... added nine points (3-4 3FG) against Oregon (Jan. 12) in 14 minutes off the bench ... contributed 12 points (3-6 3FG, 3-4 FT) and career-high four steals in season-high 22 minutes off the bench against USC (Jan. 26) ... added five points in 15 minutes as a reserve against California (Feb. 5) ... pitched in with eight points (3-6 FG, 2-5 3FG) against Arizona State (Mar. 13) ... added eight points (3-5 FG, 2-4 3FG) versus UCLA (Mar. 14) ... added season-high six rebounds to go with three points against New Mexico (Mar. 21) ... chipped in with four points and three rebounds against Kansas (Mar. 23).

2012-13: Game-by-Game Stats ... Pac-12 All-Academic First Team honoree ... NABC Honors Court selection ... competed in 34 games, making one start ... averaged 5.8 points and 2.1 rebounds ... Pac-12's leading three-point shooter, having made 45-101 (44.6 percent) overall and 27-55 (49.1 percent) in conference games ... 26-31 (83.9 percent) from the foul line ... has scored in double figures 10 times ... scored 10 points (4-10 FG, 2-7 3FG) and grabbed three boards in 22 minutes against Missouri (Nov. 22) ... added 10 points and five rebounds against Northern Iowa (Nov. 23) ... poured in 12 points (3-5 FG, 4-4 FT) in 15 minutes at Northwestern (Dec. 21) ... chipped in with 10 points and five boards in career-high 27 minutes against UCLA (Jan. 5) ... added 14 points (4-4 three-pointers) in 19 minutes off bench against California (Jan. 19) ... scored career-high 19 points (6-8 FG, 4-4 3FG) with six rebounds in 17 minutes at Utah (Jan. 27) ... added 12 points (3-6 3FG) against Oregon State (Feb. 3) ... poured in 11 points (4-7 FG, 3-4 3FG) against Arizona State (Feb. 9) ... added 11 points (3-4 3FG) against Utah (Mar. 3) ... contributed 13 points (5-6 FG, 3-4 3FG) against Arizona State (Mar. 13).

2011-12: Game-by-Game Stats ... Pac-12 All-Academic First Team selection ... played in 33 games, making two starts ... averaged 3.9 points and 1.2 rebounds per game ... made 46-107 (43.0 percent) from the field and 27-73 (37.0 percent) from long range ... tallied 10 points on 3-6 shooting in 12 minutes against Syracuse (Nov. 25) ... added eight points in 12 minutes at Seattle (Dec. 1) ... poured in 12 points on 4-6 shooting (3-5 three-pointers) in 11 minutes against Butler (Dec. 22) ... pitched in with 10 points on 4-6 shooting in 20 minutes versus UCLA (Dec. 29) ... tallied 13 points on 5-10 shooting with three triples against Oregon (Jan. 5) ... added 10 points in a win at Oregon State (Jan. 7) ... pitched in with nine points and three boards against Utah (Jan. 12) ... contributed eight points and six rebounds in 15 minutes against Oregon (Feb. 19) ... poured in 11 points on 4-5 shooting (3-4 three-pointers) at Colorado (Feb. 23).

2010-11: Game-by-Game Stats ... Appeared in 20 games, making one start ... averaged 3.8 points and 1.3 rebounds per game ... despite only playing in 166 total minutes, his season average (pro-rated totals based on a 40-minute game) ranked him as one of Stanford's most efficient players: 4.1 three-pointers per game (first), 18.1 points per game (second) and 6.0 field goals per game (third) ... canned a jumper with 16 seconds left against San Diego (Nov. 15) for his first collegiate points ... in 10 minutes against Arkansas-Pine Bluff (Nov. 21), finished with three points and five boards ... in 13 minutes against Ari-zona (Feb. 3), nailed three triples for a season-best nine points to go along with three rebounds ... totaled eight points, knocking down two three-pointers, in 15 minutes against Arizona State (Feb. 5) ... matched season-best total with nine points (all on three-pointers) against Washington (Feb. 12) ... received his first starting nod on Feb. 19 against USC, scoring six points in 18 minutes ... against Oregon State (Feb. 24), scored seven points in seven minutes off bench.

High School: 2010 graduate of Vashon Island High School in Vashon, Wash. ... three-year letterwinner in basketball ... three-time league MVP ... ranked No. 17 among centers by Scout.com ... during his senior year, established single-season school record for blocked shots (89), averaged 18.8 points per game, served as team captain and voted Best Teammate ... also during that season, named State 1A Player of the Year by Washington Interscholastic Basketball Coaches Association ... led Vashon Island High School to a state championship as a junior ... voted 1A State Tournament MVP, averaging 16.0 points and 10.0 rebounds per game.
